alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:23PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lassen County through 715 PM PDT... At 622 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Susanville, or 10 miles southeast of Eagle Lake, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Susanville, Crater Lake Campground, Aspen Grove Campground, Westwood, Christie Campground, Merrill Campground, Junction CA 36 And CA 44, Eagle Campground and Fredonyer Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
